Description: Rim sherd of Chian, probably Grand Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black (fired red) below; dotted concentric circles in added white with added red centres between lotus buds in white outline with red centres; exterior: dot and chequer band around rim above Z frieze between lines; below, figure (top of head remaining) to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos places the sherd within the Chalice Style and identifies the figure as a sphinx. The interior decoration is very elaborate and not typical of the Chalice Style, but rather the Grand Style. The rim pattern fits both styles.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no. 886)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0738) (phase 2)
